page.title: 18MILNROW LIBRARY
page.content: Milnrow library was built in 19O7 from sandstone and slate. It is named after{Andrew Carnegie}who donated Â£12,OOO,OOO for the building of libraries throughout Britain. The ground floor is used for the library and the first floor for meetings and story-telling groups. The Dewey system is used to catalogue the books. There are three sections; reference, childrens, and adults. The library opens for 35 hrs. per week. Monday , Thursday and Saturday are the busiest days. Its membership, totalling 3,499, with juniors making up 32% of this, is the sixth largest in the borough. In 1984 1O6,254 books were borrowed. There are two full-time and several part-time staff. In the children's section sport was the most popular subject and{Roald Dahl}the favourite author.
